T1036.004::[Naikon] renamed a malicious service taskmgr to appear to be a legitimate version of Task Manager.
T1036.005::[Naikon] has disguised malicious programs as Google Chrome, Adobe, and VMware executables.
T1053.005::[Naikon] has used schtasks.exe for lateral movement in compromised networks.
T1078.002::[Naikon] has used administrator credentials for lateral movement in compromised networks.

T1518.001::[Naikon] uses commands such as netsh advfirewall firewall to discover local firewall settings.
T1547.001::[Naikon] has modified a victim's Windows Run registry to establish persistence.
T1566.001::[Naikon] has used malicious e-mail attachments to deliver malware.
T1574.002::[Naikon] has used DLL side-loading to load malicious DLL's into legitimate executables.
